title: Playing League While on Vacation
body: I'm out of state visiting relatives, and I wasn't sure if opening League while I'm here would create a security issue. Is it okay if I play games even though my location isn't normal?

replies.body:
You should be juuuust fine. Those protective locks are only placed when the shift is locations seem impossible, for example, logging in from Kentucky and then 5 min later logging in from Russia. That's pretty unlikely for someone to travel that fast (not counting superheroes xP) so it's a good bet that the account could be in the process of getting stolen. 

TLDR; You shouldn't worry about this if you're on vacation, and even if it happened, just hit us up in a [**ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) for verification.
Ohh that makes sense. Thanks a bunch for the clarification!

You should be fine, as long as you are the one on the account. Could it raise any possible flags? Maybe. If it does, you can explain your situation and get it resolved. The fact that you're posting about it right now can be referenced later in the event of anything happening.
Okay, thank you! I've heard of a couple incidents where people had their accounts locked from similar situations and I didn't wanna have any problems.

I'll be moving in a year or two, and soon we'll be selling this house, so I'll be moving into an apartment soon enough. It would be silly if you could only play your account from a single location. But if they do put a hold on your account, it's usually their way of looking out for you, to make sure it's really you.
